Example 5.14
Consider the function
f(x) =
√
x2 + exp(x2) + cos
(
x2 + exp(x2)
)
(5.122)
from (5.109). If we were to implement a function f on a computer, we
would be able to save some computation by using intermediate variables:intermediate
variables
a= x2 , (5.123)
b= exp(a) , (5.124)
c= a+ b, (5.125)
d= √c, (5.126)
e= cos(c) , (5.127)
f = d+ e. (5.128)
Figure 5.11
Computation graph
with inputs x,
function values f,
and intermediate
variables a,b,c,d,e .
x (·)2 a
exp(·) b
+ c
√·
cos(·)
d
e
+ f
